In the given scenario with a 90% accurate machine and a trustworthy source, how many people would be falsely identified as a terrorist?
If there are 30 people in the building, and the machine is 10% likely to produce false positives (due to base rate fallacy), then 3 people would be falsely identified as a terrorist.

And if the number of false positives is high, then this will significantly lower the probability that the identification method has correctly identified the phenomenon in question.
